params.name: name
params.description: A unique name for this RabbitMQ Inbound Endpoint configuration.

params.name: sequence
params.description: The name of the **mediation sequence** that will process the consumed RabbitMQ messages.

params.name: onError
params.description: The name of the **error handling sequence** to execute if an error occurs during message consumption or processing.

params.name: inbound.behavior
params.description: Defines the message consumption mode (e.g., event-based for immediate processing).

params.name: sequential
params.description: If enabled, messages will be processed one after the other within the injection sequence, preserving message order.

params.name: coordination
params.description: In a clustered environment, set this to true to ensure that only a **single worker node** is consuming messages from the queue at any given time.

params.name: rabbitmq.server.host.name
params.description: Enter RabbitMQ server Hostnames as a comma-separated list (e.g., host1,host2).

params.name: rabbitmq.server.port
params.description: Enter RabbitMQ server ports as a comma-separated list (e.g., port1,port2). Default is 5672 for non-SSL.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.name
params.description: The name of the RabbitMQ queue to consume messages from.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.type
params.description: Queue type to interact with: **CLASSIC**, **QUORUM** (high availability), or **STREAM** (large, continuous flow).

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the queue if it doesn't exist.

params.name: rabbitmq.exchange.name
params.description: Name of the exchange to bind the queue to. Leave empty to consume directly from the queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.exchange.type
params.description: Type of the exchange: **DIRECT**, **FANOUT**, **TOPIC**, or **HEADERS**.

params.name: rabbitmq.exchange.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the exchange if it doesn't exist.

params.name: rabbitmq.routing.key
params.description: Routing key for binding the queue to a **DIRECT** or **TOPIC** exchange. Queue name is used if omitted.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.sasl.mechanism
params.description: Select the SASL mechanism for connection authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.enabled
params.description: Enable OAuth 2.0 (e.g., Client Credentials or Password Grant) for authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.server.user.name
params.description: Username for PLAIN authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.server.password
params.description: Password for PLAIN authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.token.endpoint
params.description: The OAuth 2.0 token endpoint URL to retrieve the access token.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.grant.type
params.description: The OAuth 2.0 grant type to use for token retrieval.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.client.id
params.description: The client ID for OAuth 2.0 authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.client.secret
params.description: The client secret for OAuth 2.0 authentication.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.username
params.description: Username required when using the **password** OAuth 2.0 grant type.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.password
params.description: Password required when using the **password** OAuth 2.0 grant type.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.idle.timeout
params.description: Maximum period (in milliseconds) the connection can remain idle before being closed.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.establish.retry.count
params.description: Number of times to retry establishing the connection. Leave blank for default.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.establish.retry.interval
params.description: Interval (in milliseconds) between retries when establishing the connection.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.policy.type
params.description: Defines the strategy for automatic connection recovery after a disconnection.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.initial.delay
params.description: Initial delay (in milliseconds) before the first recovery attempt starts.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.retry.interval
params.description: Fixed interval (in milliseconds) between connection recovery retries.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.retry.timeout
params.description: Total time (in milliseconds) allowed for the connection recovery process before giving up.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.arguments
params.description: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value) to use when declaring the queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.classic.version
params.description: For Classic Queues: select the queue version (V1 or V2). V2 offers better performance.

params.name: rabbitmq.classic.dead.letter.strategy
params.description: Strategy for failed messages: retry and discard, or discard immediately.

params.name: rabbitmq.classic.max.priority
params.description: For Classic Queues: the maximum priority level the queue should support (0-255).

params.name: rabbitmq.quorum.initial.member.count
params.description: For Quorum Queues: the initial number of replica nodes required.

params.name: rabbitmq.quorum.delivery.limit
params.description: For Quorum Queues: maximum times a message can be redelivered before dead-lettering.

params.name: rabbitmq.quorum.dead.letter.strategy
params.description: For Quorum Queues: defines the acknowledgment and redelivery behavior for failed messages.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.initial.member.count
params.description: For STREAM queues: the initial number of stream members. Leave blank for default.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.max.age
params.description: For STREAM queues: maximum retention time for stream data (e.g., '300').

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.max.segment.size
params.description: For STREAM queues: maximum size (in bytes) of a single segment file.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.exclusive
params.description: If enabled, the queue is deleted when the declaring connection closes. Only one consumer can use it.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.auto.delete
params.description: If enabled, the queue is deleted when the last consumer disconnects.

params.name: rabbitmq.header.exchange.binding.arguments
params.description: For **HEADERS** exchanges: set binding headers (e.g., `x-match=any`).

params.name: rabbitmq.exchange.arguments
params.description: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value) to use when declaring the exchange.

params.name: rabbitmq.exchange.auto.delete
params.description: If enabled, the exchange is deleted when the last queue is unbound.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.filters
params.description: For STREAM queues: filters (comma-separated values) to apply when consuming messages. Only matching messages are consumed.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.filter.match.unfiltered
params.description: If checked, messages without a filter value will also be consumed.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.starting.value
params.description: Message consumption starts from this specific offset value (e.g., message position). This value overrides the Offset Strategy.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.starting.strategy
params.description: Where consumption starts: **FIRST**, **LAST**, or **NEXT** (for new chunks).

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.tracker.flush.interval
params.description: Frequency (in seconds) to persist the consumer's current offset.

params.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.tracker.shutdown.timeout
params.description: Time (in seconds) to wait for the offset tracker to safely flush state on shutdown.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.enabled
params.description: Enable SSL/TLS for the RabbitMQ connection.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.trust.everything
params.description: If enabled, all server certificates are accepted. **Not recommended for production.**

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.location
params.description: File path to the Keystore containing the client's private key and certificate.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.type
params.description: The type of the Keystore (e.g., JKS).

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.password
params.description: The password to access the Keystore.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.location
params.description: File path to the Truststore containing trusted server certificates.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.type
params.description: The type of the Truststore (e.g., JKS).

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.password
params.description: The password to access the Truststore.

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.version
params.description: The preferred SSL/TLS protocol version (e.g., 'TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.3').

params.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.hostname.verification.enabled
params.description: If enabled, verifies the hostname in the server's certificate against the connected host name.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.name
params.description: The name of the Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) for failed messages.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.type
params.description: The type of the Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.name
params.description: The name of the Dead Letter Exchange (DLX) to route dead-lettered messages.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.type
params.description: The type of the Dead Letter Exchange.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the Dead Letter Exchange.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.routing.key
params.description: The routing key for messages sent to the Dead Letter Exchange (for DIRECT DLXs only).

params.name: rabbitmq.max.dead.lettered.count
params.description: Maximum times a message can be dead-lettered and retried before being sent to the final DLQ.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.name
params.description: The name of the final DLQ for messages that exceed the Max Dead Lettered Count.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.type
params.description: The type of the final Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the final Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.name
params.description: The name of the final Dead Letter Exchange to route messages exceeding retry limits.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.type
params.description: The type of the final Dead Letter Exchange.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.auto.declare
params.description: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the final Dead Letter Exchange.

params.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.routing.key
params.description: The routing key for messages sent to the final Dead Letter Exchange (for DIRECT DLXs only).

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.interval
params.description: Interval (in milliseconds) between retries when publishing to a Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.count
params.description: Number of times to retry publishing a message to a Dead Letter Queue.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.exponential.factor
params.description: Exponential backoff factor applied to the retry interval (e.g., 2.0 doubles the interval).

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.ack.wait.time
params.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for the broker to acknowledge a dead-letter message.

params.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.shutdown.timeout
params.description: Time (in milliseconds) to wait for the dead letter publisher to shut down gracefully.

params.name: rabbitmq.throttle.enabled
params.description: If enabled, message consumption will be throttled to a specified rate.

params.name: rabbitmq.throttle.mode
params.description: Mode of throttling: **FIXED_INTERVAL** or **BATCH**.

params.name: rabbitmq.throttle.timeUnit
params.description: The time unit for the throttling rate: per **MINUTE**, **HOUR**, or **DAY**.

params.name: rabbitmq.throttle.count
params.description: Maximum number of messages to consume within the specified time unit.

params.name: rabbitmq.server.virtual.host
params.description: The virtual host (vhost) to connect to. Leave blank for the default '/' vhost.

params.name: rabbitmq.message.content.type
params.description: The Content-Type header to set for the consumed message  if the content-type cannot be determined from the consumed message.

params.name: rabbitmq.message.content.encoding
params.description: The content encoding/character set (e.g., UTF-8) used for the message body if the encoding/character set cannot be determined from the consumed message.

params.name: rabbitmq.queue.overflow.strategy
params.description: What happens when queue is full: **DROP_HEAD** (oldest discarded), **REJECT_PUBLISH**, or **REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX**.

params.name: rabbitmq.message.requeue.delay
params.description: Delay (in milliseconds) before a failed message is automatically requeued.

params.name: rabbitmq.auto.ack.enabled
params.description: If enabled, messages are automatically acknowledged (ACKed) upon receipt.

params.name: rabbitmq.ack.wait.time
params.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for a message acknowledgment (ACK).

params.name: rabbitmq.concurrent.consumers.count
params.description: The number of concurrent consumers to create for processing messages.

params.name: rabbitmq.message.receiver.thread.pool.size
params.description: Size of the thread pool for receiving messages. Recommended to be greater than the number of concurrent consumers.

params.name: rabbitmq.consumer.initial.credit
params.description: The prefetch count, limiting unacknowledged messages sent to the consumer (QoS).

params.name: rabbitmq.classic.override.requeue.with.discard
params.description: For Classic Queues: if enabled, any requeue attempt for a failed message will result in discard instead.

params.description: A unique name for this RabbitMQ Inbound Endpoint configuration.

params.name: sequence
params.description: The name of the **mediation sequence** that will process the consumed RabbitMQ messages.

params.name: onError
params.description: The name of the **error handling sequence** to execute if an error occurs during message consumption or processing.

params.name: coordination

params.name: rabbitmq.ack.wait.time

params.name: rabbitmq.message.receiver.thread.pool.size
